events.message: The insured called to file a claim for a car accident that occurred on March 30th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report mentioning damages to the vehicle's front bumper and airbags deployed.
Agent John Matthews was assigned to handle the claim and contacted the insured promptly to gather further details about the vehicle collision.
Acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the customer, assuring them that the investigation into their car accident will begin immediately.
We requested the insured to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the auto accident claim evaluation.
The insured submitted all requested documents including the police accident report, vehicle repair estimates, and detailed photographs of the damage.
The investigation team commenced review of the documents and started assessment of the liability and damage extent related to the reported vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured was not at fault and the damage to the car is consistent with the circumstances described in the accident report.
A settlement offer was proposed to the insured covering repair costs minus deductible and to cover the total loss claim for the vehicle.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of their auto accident claim and accepted the proposed settlement terms without objections.
After final approval by the claims manager, the auto accident claim was officially approved for payment and processing to repair the insuredâ€™s vehicle.
Payment was issued to the insured for the approved settlement amount covering all agreed automobile repair expenses related to the collision.
The auto accident claim file was closed after confirming receipt of payment and completion of all necessary claim processing activities.
The claim documents and investigation records were archived securely in the system for future reference in line with company policies.
